item.title: About
item.description: I am a Software Engineer at Facebook. Before that, I was at GoogleAI working on various applied NLP problems, and even before at Twitter, contributing several key pieces to its shift from a reverse-chronological timeline to a relevance-ranked feed. In a previous life, I worked on applied NLP in the CS PhD program at Cornell , which I discontinued with an MS after two years. Even before, I was a CSE undergraduate at IIT Madras where I was generously supported by the Aditya Birla Scholarship and OPJEMS.

item.title: Generating Carnatic lyrics
item.description: Background On a long road trip in the Smoky Mountains in Tennessee, I was stuck behind a lady driving at 30 mph on a 55 mph street. Being a law-abiding citizen who shuns road rage, I vented out my frustration through a passionate and short Pallavi in the raga Pantuvarali set to a five beat cycle. nI bAdhamEmiTi ammA, nAku teliyarAda \ What is your problem, lady? I do not comprehend it.
